messages.content:
You are a world state generator for a workplace benchmark. Your job is to transform an abstract scenario into a concrete, detailed world_state JSON.

The world_state should include:
1. All metadata from the scenario (scenario_id, description, noise_level, depth, global_settings, people, projects)
2. sub_scenarios_expanded: For each abstract sub_scenario from the input scenario, create a concrete expanded version with:
   - Concrete ISO datetime timestamps
   - Specific participant IDs/emails
   - Detailed event descriptions
   - Any seeds needed for data generation
   - This array should contain ONLY the expanded versions of the sub_scenarios listed in the input scenario
3. noise_scenarios: An array of noise-only scenario objects that are NOT part of the core sub_scenarios:
   - These should be realistic but unrelated workplace events/messages/activities
   - Each noise scenario should have similar structure to sub_scenarios_expanded (id, type, timestamps, participants, etc.)
   - The number of noise scenarios should scale with the noise_level parameter

IMPORTANT: Do NOT include per_source_plans in the world_state. The world_state is scenario-centric only.

IMPORTANT PARAMETERS:
- noise_level (0-1): Controls amount of unrelated/off-task data
  * 0 = almost no noise, only data directly relevant to sub_scenarios (noise_scenarios should be empty or minimal)
  * 1 = lots of unrelated messages/events/files (still realistic) (noise_scenarios should contain many entries)
- depth (0-1): Controls how indirect the evidence is
  * 0 = sub_scenario realized directly (e.g., one clear Slack message)
  * 1 = sub_scenario requires multi-step, multi-source chaining to infer
  * Intermediate values interpolate behavior

CRITICAL: sub_scenarios_expanded must correspond exactly to the sub_scenarios in the input scenario. All other unrelated scenarios should go in noise_scenarios.

You must output ONLY valid JSON matching the world_state schema. Do not include markdown code fences.

raw_message.content:

        "events": [
          {
            "id": "pm_v4_evt_01",

            "timestamp": "2025-11-05T09:02:13+00:00",
            "participants": [

            "summary": "Alex mentions need for early sync with support and sales engineers about WEB project.",

Jordan from Sales Eng and Sam from Support come to mind. I’d like to grab them tomorrow morning for ~45 mins if possible, just to sanity‑check scope.\"",

            ]

Do you have any hard blocks in that window?\"\n\nJordan Johnson: \"Hey Alex, I’m on a customer call 10:00–10:45, and I’ve got travel later in the day. Do you have a window in the morning that works?\"\n\nSam Williams: \"Hey Alex, I’m covering EU support from 8 to 9, so I’d rather not block 09:00 sharp. Anything from 09:15 onwards is fine, as long as we’re done before 11 when I have training.\"",

            "summary": "Alex proposes a concrete time window for the sync via email.",
            "content": "From: Alex Smith <alex.smith@company.com>\nTo: Jordan Johnson <jordan.johnson@company.com>; Sam Williams <sam.williams@company.com>\nSubject: Website Redesign discovery sync (tomorrow AM)\nDate: Wed, 5 Nov 2025 09:40:03 +0000\n\nHi both,\n\nAs mentioned on Slack, I’d like to do a short discovery / sanity check session about the Website Redesign (WEB) ahead of next week’s planning milestone.\n\nCould we do 09:15–10:00 UK time tomorrow (Thu 6 Nov)? That should give us 45 minutes while staying out of your other commitments.\n\nAgenda (draft):\n- Quick overview of WEB goals\n- Top customer pain points you’re hearing\n- Must‑haves vs nice‑to‑haves for v1\n\nIf that timing doesn’t work, send me a couple of alternatives in the morning and I’ll adjust the invite.\n\nThanks,\nAlex",

            ],

            "content": "From: Jordan Johnson <jordan.johnson@company.com>\nTo: Alex Smith <alex.smith@company.com>; Sam Williams <sam.williams@company.com>\nSubject: Re: Website Redesign discovery sync (tomorrow AM)\nDate: Wed, 5 Nov 2025 09:52:19 +0000\n\nWorks for me. 09:15–10:00 UK tomorrow is good.\n\nJordan",

            ]
          },

            "source": "email",
            "timestamp": "2025-11-05T10:01:44+00:00",
            "participants": [

            "content": "From: Sam Williams <sam.williams@company.com>\nTo: Alex Smith <alex.smith@company.com>; Jordan Johnson <jordan.johnson@company.com>\nSubject: Re: Website Redesign discovery sync (tomorrow AM)\nDate: Wed, 5 Nov 2025 10:01:44 +0000\n\n09:15 tomorrow is okay, but could we possibly start 10 minutes later? That gives me a bit of buffer after my early shift.\n\nSo 09:25–10:10 UK would be ideal on my side, if that still avoids your other meetings.\n\nSam",

OK if I join standup a few mins late just this once?\"\n\nTaylor Brown: \"Yeah, that’s fine as long as you post notes afterwards. This convo is more important for WEB right now.\"",

    {

      "type": "feature_rollout_eta",
      "abstract_description": "A customer asks about the ETA of a feature which is tracked in Jira.",
      "issue_key_hint": "WEB-101",
      "expanded": {
        "timezone": "Europe/London",
        "date_context": "2025-11-06",
        "description": "A customer asks Support about the ETA for a core feature of the Website Redesign, which is tracked in Jira as WEB-101. The answer is pieced together from a support ticket, a Slack thread, an internal email summarizing the plan, and the Jira issue itself.",
        "events": [
          {
            "id": "eta_evt_01",
            "source": "support_ticket",
            "timestamp": "2025-11-06T08:17:55+00:00",
            "participants": [
              "person_sam_williams"
            ],
            "summary": "Customer opens ticket asking when new Website Redesign feature will be available.",
            "content": "Ticket ID: #8421\nChannel: Email\nOwner: Sam Williams\n\nCustomer message:\n\"Hi team,\n\nWe saw in your roadmap webinar that you’re working on a revamped website experience, including a new customizable pricing page. Can you share an estimated timeline for when that pricing page feature will be rolled out? We’re planning our own marketing campaigns around it.\n\nThanks,\"\n\nSam tags this as related to Website Redesign and notes that he needs to confirm ETA.",
            "tags": [
              "website-redesign",
              "pricing-page",
              "eta-request"
            ]
          },
          {
            "id": "eta_evt_02",
            "source": "support_system_note",
            "timestamp": "2025-11-06T08:24:18+00:00",
            "participants": [
              "person_sam_williams"
            ],
            "summary": "Sam links ticket to Jira issue WEB-101.",
            "content": "Internal note on ticket #8421:\n\n\"Linking this to WEB-101 (\"Website Redesign - Core Feature\") in Jira. Need PM confirmation on when WEB-101 is expected to hit prod so we can give customer a realistic ETA.\"\n\nJira link added: https://jira.company.com/browse/WEB-101",
            "related_issue_keys": [
              "WEB-101"
            ]
          },
          {
            "id": "eta_evt_03",
            "source": "jira",
            "timestamp": "2025-11-06T08:25:10+00:00",
            "participants": [
              "person_alex_smith",
              "person_taylor_brown"
            ],
            "summary": "Current state of Jira issue WEB-101 shows it's in development with a target aligned to the Launch milestone.",
            "jira_issue": {
              "issue_key": "WEB-101",
              "summary": "Website Redesign - Core Feature",
              "status": "In Progress",
              "assignee": "person_taylor_brown",
              "reporter": "person_alex_smith",
              "project_key": "WEB",
              "fix_versions": [
                {
                  "name": "WEB Launch",
                  "releaseDate": "2025-11-30"
                }
              ],
              "custom_fields": {
                "target_rollout_week": "2025-W48",
                "deployment_strategy": "staged-rollout-20-80"
              },
              "description": "Implement the core Website Redesign experience, including the new configurable pricing page.\n\nNotes:\n- Must be ready for production rollout by end of November.\n- We plan a staged rollout over ~1 week.",
              "comments": [
                {
                  "author": "person_taylor_brown",
                  "created": "2025-11-04T14:11:22+00:00",
                  "body": "Backend work is nearly done; front-end integration in progress.\nWe are still on track for code complete by around 20 Nov, with rollout starting shortly after."
                },
                {
                  "author": "person_alex_smith",
                  "created": "2025-11-05T16:48:03+00:00",
                  "body": "Reminder: This needs to be available to at least 50% of customers before the 30 Nov launch milestone. Ideally start rollout week of 24 Nov."
                }
              ]
            }
          },
          {
            "id": "eta_evt_04",
            "source": "slack",
            "channel": "support-internal",
            "timestamp": "2025-11-06T08:32:09+00:00",
            "participants": [
              "person_sam_williams",
              "person_alex_smith"
            ],
            "summary": "Sam pings Alex on Slack asking for a customer-friendly ETA based on WEB-101.",
            "content": "Sam Williams: \"@Alex I’ve got ticket #8421 asking when the new pricing page from the Website Redesign will be live. I’ve linked it to WEB-101 but don’t want to over‑promise. Is it fair to say ‘end of November’ or should we couch it more conservatively?\"\n\nAlex Smith: \"Hey Sam, good call on checking. Officially WEB-101 is tied to the 30 Nov launch milestone, but we’re planning a gradual rollout that should start earlier that week. Let me write something you can send.\"",
            "related_issue_keys": [
              "WEB-101"
            ],
            "related_project_keys": [
              "WEB"
            ]
          },
          {
            "id": "eta_evt_05",
            "source": "email",
            "timestamp": "2025-11-06T08:41:27+00:00",
            "participants": [
              "person_alex_smith",
              "person_sam_williams"
            ],
            "subject": "Re: Ticket #8421 – ETA for Website Redesign pricing page",
            "summary": "Alex sends Sam suggested wording for the ETA response.",
            "content": "From: Alex Smith <alex.smith@company.com>\nTo: Sam Williams <sam.williams@company.com>\nSubject: Re: Ticket #8421 – ETA for Website Redesign pricing page\nDate: Thu, 6 Nov 2025 08:41:27 +0000\n\nHey Sam,\n\nHere’s some phrasing you can safely use with the customer:\n\n\"We’re currently finishing development of the new pricing page as part of our Website Redesign. Barring any last‑minute issues, we expect to begin rolling it out in the final week of November, with full availability by around the end of the month.\"\n\nThis lines up with WEB-101’s current plan (tied to the 30 Nov launch). Please avoid committing to an exact day since rollout will be staged.\n\nAlex",
            "related_issue_keys": [
              "WEB-101"
            ],
            "related_project_keys": [
              "WEB"
            ]
          },
          {
            "id": "eta_evt_06",
            "source": "support_ticket",
            "timestamp": "2025-11-06T08:55:02+00:00",
            "participants": [
              "person_sam_williams"
            ],
            "summary": "Sam responds to the customer with the ETA using Alex's wording.",
            "content": "Public reply on ticket #8421 by Sam Williams:\n\n\"Thanks for reaching out and for your interest in the new pricing page.\n\nWe’re currently finishing development of this feature as part of our broader Website Redesign. Barring any last‑minute issues, we expect to begin rolling it out in the final week of November, with full availability by around the end of the month.\n\nWe’ll keep you updated via our release notes as we get closer to rollout.\"\n\nTicket status updated to: Pending Customer",
            "tags": [
              "eta-provided",
              "website-redesign",
              "pricing-page"
            ],
            "related_issue_keys": [
              "WEB-101"
            ]
          }
        ]
      }
    },
    {
      "id": "weekly_report",
      "type": "weekly_report",
      "abstract_description": "PM summarizes weekly wins such as performance improvements and user growth.",
      "metrics_hint": {
        "performance_improvement_percent": 15,
        "users_growth_percent": 10
      },
      "expanded": {
        "timezone": "Europe/London",
        "date_context": "2025-11-07",
        "description": "Alex prepares a weekly status update email highlighting performance improvements and user growth, referencing Website Redesign metrics indirectly via analytics and internal notes.",
        "events": [
          {
            "id": "wr_evt_01",
            "source": "analytics_dashboard",
            "timestamp": "2025-11-07T09:05:10+00:00",
            "participants": [
              "person_alex_smith"
            ],
            "summary": "Alex checks analytics for load time improvements and user signups.",
            "content": "Alex loads the \"WEB Performance\" dashboard for 2025-10-31 to 2025-11-06.\n\nKey metrics viewed:\n- Median page load time: improved from 2.0s to 1.7s (approx. 15% faster)\n- Homepage bounce rate: decreased from 48% to 43%\n- Weekly new signups influenced by web traffic: up ~10% week over week",
            "metrics": {
              "performance_improvement_percent": 15,
              "users_growth_percent": 10
            },
            "related_project_keys": [
              "WEB"
            ]
          },
          {
            "id": "wr_evt_02",
            "source": "slack",
            "channel": "eng-website-redesign",
            "timestamp": "2025-11-07T09:18:41+00:00",
            "participants": [
              "person_alex_smith",
              "person_taylor_brown"
            ],
            "summary": "Alex asks Taylor to validate performance numbers for the weekly report.",
            "content": "Alex Smith: \"@Taylor I’m pulling together the weekly update. From the dashboard it looks like we’ve shaved about 300ms off load times this week, which is roughly a 15% improvement vs last week. Does that align with what you’re seeing from the synthetic tests?\"\n\nTaylor Brown: \"Yep, that matches our numbers. After the CDN tweaks and image optimizations, we’re seeing 14–16% faster loads across the main flows. You can quote ~15% in your update.\"",
            "related_project_keys": [
              "WEB"
            ]
          },
          {
            "id": "wr_evt_03",
            "source": "slack",
            "channel": "sales-eng",
            "timestamp": "2025-11-07T09:32:22+00:00",
            "participants": [
              "person_alex_smith",
              "person_jordan_johnson"
            ],
            "summary": "Alex asks Jordan about user growth and qualitative feedback.",
            "content": "Alex Smith: \"Jordan, for the weekly report I’m planning to call out some user growth tied to the recent website improvements. From your side, does ~10% week‑over‑week growth in signups from web traffic sound reasonable to mention?\"\n\nJordan Johnson: \"Yeah, that lines up with what RevOps shared. We’ve seen about a 9–11% bump depending on the segment. Customers also keep commenting that the site feels ‘snappier’.\"",
            "related_project_keys": [
              "WEB"
            ]
          },
          {
            "id": "wr_evt_04",
            "source": "document",
            "timestamp": "2025-11-07T10:02:55+00:00",
            "participants": [
              "person_alex_smith"
            ],
            "summary": "Alex drafts the weekly wins section in a notes doc.",
            "content": "Alex adds the following bullets to a personal note titled \"Weekly Wins – 7 Nov 2025\":\n\n- Website performance: ~15% faster median load times vs last week after CDN and image optimizations.\n- Growth: ~10% uplift in new signups driven by web traffic, supported by better conversion on the updated pages.\n- Qualitative: Several prospects mentioned the site feels more responsive and easier to navigate.",
            "metrics": {
              "performance_improvement_percent": 15,
              "users_growth_percent": 10
            },
            "related_project_keys": [
              "WEB"
            ]
          },
          {
            "id": "wr_evt_05",
            "source": "email",
            "timestamp": "2025-11-07T10:28:16+00:00",
            "participants": [
              "person_alex_smith",
              "person_taylor_brown",
              "person_jordan_johnson",
              "person_sam_williams",
              "person_casey_jones"
            ],
            "subject": "Weekly Product Update – 7 Nov 2025",
            "summary": "Alex sends weekly product update highlighting performance and user growth.",
            "content": "From: Alex Smith <alex.smith@company.com>\nTo: Eng & GTM Stakeholders <eng-gtm@company.com>\nCc: Taylor Brown <taylor.brown@company.com>; Jordan Johnson <jordan.johnson@company.com>; Sam Williams <sam.williams@company.com>; Casey Jones <casey.jones@company.com>\nSubject: Weekly Product Update – 7 Nov 2025\nDate: Fri, 7 Nov 2025 10:28:16 +0000\n\nHi all,\n\nA few highlights from this week:\n\n1) Website performance\n- After the latest Website Redesign optimizations, our median page load time improved by roughly 15% compared to last week.\n- Early feedback from sales calls suggests prospects are noticing the snappier experience.\n\n2) User growth\n- New signups driven by web traffic are up about 10% week over week.\n- We’re seeing better conversion on the updated landing flows, which we’ll continue to iterate on.\n\n3) What’s next\n- We’re preparing for the upcoming WEB planning milestone on 10 Nov and the development phase starting 20 Nov.\n- Core feature work (WEB-101) remains on track for a late‑November rollout.\n\nThanks again for all the hard work this week.\n\nAlex",
            "metrics": {
              "performance_improvement_percent": 15,
              "users_growth_percent": 10
            },
            "related_project_keys": [
              "WEB"
            ],
            "related_issue_keys": [
              "WEB-101"
            ]
          }
        ]
      }
    }
